text: Now it came to pass in the days [strongs id="h3117" /] of Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /], (this [is] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /] which reigned [strongs id="h4427" tvm="8802" /], from India [strongs id="h1912" /] even unto Ethiopia [strongs id="h3568" /], [over] an hundred [strongs id="h3967" /] and seven [strongs id="h7651" /] and twenty [strongs id="h6242" /] provinces [strongs id="h4082" /]:)

[That] in those days [strongs id="h3117" /], when the king [strongs id="h4428" /] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /] sat [strongs id="h3427" tvm="8800" /] on the throne [strongs id="h3678" /] of his kingdom [strongs id="h4438" /], which [was] in Shushan [strongs id="h7800" /] the palace [strongs id="h1002" /],

In the third [strongs id="h7969" /] year [strongs id="h8141" /] of his reign [strongs id="h4427" tvm="8800" /], he made [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] a feast [strongs id="h4960" /] unto all his princes [strongs id="h8269" /] and his servants [strongs id="h5650" /]; the power [strongs id="h2428" /] of Persia [strongs id="h6539" /] and Media [strongs id="h4074" /], the nobles [strongs id="h6579" /] and princes [strongs id="h8269" /] of the provinces [strongs id="h4082" /], [being] before [strongs id="h6440" /] him:

When he shewed [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8687" /] the riches [strongs id="h6239" /] of his glorious [strongs id="h3519" /] kingdom [strongs id="h4438" /] and the honour [strongs id="h3366" /] of his excellent [strongs id="h8597" /] majesty [strongs id="h1420" /] many [strongs id="h7227" /] days [strongs id="h3117" /], [even] an hundred [strongs id="h3967" /] and fourscore [strongs id="h8084" /] days [strongs id="h3117" /].

And when these days [strongs id="h3117" /] were expired [strongs id="h4390" tvm="8800" /], the king [strongs id="h4428" /] made [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] a feast [strongs id="h4960" /] unto all the people [strongs id="h5971" /] that were present [strongs id="h4672" tvm="8737" /] in Shushan [strongs id="h7800" /] the palace [strongs id="h1002" /], both unto great [strongs id="h1419" /] and small [strongs id="h6996" /], seven [strongs id="h7651" /] days [strongs id="h3117" /], in the court [strongs id="h2691" /] of the garden [strongs id="h1594" /] of the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] palace [strongs id="h1055" /];

[Where were] white [strongs id="h2353" /], green [strongs id="h3768" /], and blue [strongs id="h8504" /], [hangings], fastened [strongs id="h270" tvm="8803" /] with cords [strongs id="h2256" /] of fine linen [strongs id="h948" /] and purple [strongs id="h713" /] to silver [strongs id="h3701" /] rings [strongs id="h1550" /] and pillars [strongs id="h5982" /] of marble [strongs id="h8336" /]: the beds [strongs id="h4296" /] [were of] gold [strongs id="h2091" /] and silver [strongs id="h3701" /], upon a pavement [strongs id="h7531" /] of red [strongs id="h923" /], and blue [strongs id="h8504" /], and white [strongs id="h1858" /], and black [strongs id="h5508" /], marble [strongs id="h8336" /].

And they gave [them] drink [strongs id="h8248" tvm="8687" /] in vessels [strongs id="h3627" /] of gold [strongs id="h2091" /], (the vessels [strongs id="h3627" /] being diverse [strongs id="h8138" tvm="8802" /] one from another [strongs id="h3627" /],) and royal [strongs id="h4438" /] wine [strongs id="h3196" /] in abundance [strongs id="h7227" /], according to the state [strongs id="h3027" /] of the king [strongs id="h4428" /].

And the drinking [strongs id="h8360" /] [was] according to the law [strongs id="h1881" /]; none did compel [strongs id="h597" tvm="8802" /]: for so the king [strongs id="h4428" /] had appointed [strongs id="h3245" tvm="8765" /] to all the officers [strongs id="h7227" /] of his house [strongs id="h1004" /], that they should do [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8800" /] according to every man’s [strongs id="h376" /] pleasure [strongs id="h7522" /].

Also Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /] the queen [strongs id="h4436" /] made [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] a feast [strongs id="h4960" /] for the women [strongs id="h802" /] [in] the royal [strongs id="h4438" /] house [strongs id="h1004" /] which [belonged] to king [strongs id="h4428" /] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /].

On the seventh [strongs id="h7637" /] day [strongs id="h3117" /], when the heart [strongs id="h3820" /] of the king [strongs id="h4428" /] was merry [strongs id="h2896" /] with wine [strongs id="h3196" /], he commanded [strongs id="h559" tvm="8804" /] Mehuman [strongs id="h4104" /], Biztha [strongs id="h968" /], Harbona [strongs id="h2726" /], Bigtha [strongs id="h903" /], and Abagtha [strongs id="h5" /], Zethar [strongs id="h2242" /], and Carcas [strongs id="h3752" /], the seven [strongs id="h7651" /] chamberlains [strongs id="h5631" /] that served [strongs id="h8334" tvm="8764" /] in the presence [strongs id="h6440" /] of Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /] the king [strongs id="h4428" /],

To bring [strongs id="h935" tvm="8687" /] Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /] the queen [strongs id="h4436" /] before [strongs id="h6440" /] the king [strongs id="h4428" /] with the crown [strongs id="h3804" /] royal [strongs id="h4438" /], to shew [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8687" /] the people [strongs id="h5971" /] and the princes [strongs id="h8269" /] her beauty [strongs id="h3308" /]: for she [was] fair [strongs id="h2896" /] to look on [strongs id="h4758" /].

But the queen [strongs id="h4436" /] Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /] refused [strongs id="h3985" tvm="8762" /] to come [strongs id="h935" tvm="8800" /] at the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] commandment [strongs id="h1697" /] by [strongs id="h3027" /] [his] chamberlains [strongs id="h5631" /]: therefore was the king [strongs id="h4428" /] very [strongs id="h3966" /] wroth [strongs id="h7107" tvm="8799" /], and his anger [strongs id="h2534" /] burned [strongs id="h1197" tvm="8804" /] in him.

Then the king [strongs id="h4428" /] said [strongs id="h559" tvm="8799" /] to the wise men [strongs id="h2450" /], which knew [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8802" /] the times [strongs id="h6256" /], (for so [was] the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] manner [strongs id="h1697" /] toward [strongs id="h6440" /] all that knew [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8802" /] law [strongs id="h1881" /] and judgment [strongs id="h1779" /]:

And the next [strongs id="h7138" /] unto him [was] Carshena [strongs id="h3771" /], Shethar [strongs id="h8369" /], Admatha [strongs id="h133" /], Tarshish [strongs id="h8659" /], Meres [strongs id="h4825" /], Marsena [strongs id="h4826" /], [and] Memucan [strongs id="h4462" /], the seven [strongs id="h7651" /] princes [strongs id="h8269" /] of Persia [strongs id="h6539" /] and Media [strongs id="h4074" /], which saw [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8802" /] the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] face [strongs id="h6440" /], [and] which sat [strongs id="h3427" tvm="8802" /] the first [strongs id="h7223" /] in the kingdom [strongs id="h4438" /];)

What shall we do [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8800" /] unto the queen [strongs id="h4436" /] Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /] according to law [strongs id="h1881" /], because she hath not performed [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /] the commandment [strongs id="h3982" /] of the king [strongs id="h4428" /] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /] by [strongs id="h3027" /] the chamberlains [strongs id="h5631" /]?

And Memucan [strongs id="h4462" /] answered [strongs id="h559" tvm="8799" /] before [strongs id="h6440" /] the king [strongs id="h4428" /] and the princes [strongs id="h8269" /], Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /] the queen [strongs id="h4436" /] hath not done wrong [strongs id="h5753" tvm="8804" /] to the king [strongs id="h4428" /] only, but also to all the princes [strongs id="h8269" /], and to all the people [strongs id="h5971" /] that [are] in all the provinces [strongs id="h4082" /] of the king [strongs id="h4428" /] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /].

For [this] deed [strongs id="h1697" /] of the queen [strongs id="h4436" /] shall come abroad [strongs id="h3318" tvm="8799" /] unto all women [strongs id="h802" /], so that they shall despise [strongs id="h959" tvm="8687" /] their husbands [strongs id="h1167" /] in their eyes [strongs id="h5869" /], when it shall be reported [strongs id="h559" tvm="8800" /], The king [strongs id="h4428" /] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /] commanded [strongs id="h559" tvm="8804" /] Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /] the queen [strongs id="h4436" /] to be brought in [strongs id="h935" tvm="8687" /] before [strongs id="h6440" /] him, but she came [strongs id="h935" tvm="8804" /] not.

[Likewise] shall the ladies [strongs id="h8282" /] of Persia [strongs id="h6539" /] and Media [strongs id="h4074" /] say [strongs id="h559" tvm="8799" /] this day [strongs id="h3117" /] unto all the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] princes [strongs id="h8269" /], which have heard [strongs id="h8085" tvm="8804" /] of the deed [strongs id="h1697" /] of the queen [strongs id="h4436" /]. If it please [strongs id="h2895" tvm="8804" /] the king [strongs id="h4428" /], let there go [strongs id="h3318" tvm="8799" /] a royal [strongs id="h4438" /] commandment [strongs id="h1697" /] from him [strongs id="h6440" /], and let it be written [strongs id="h3789" tvm="8735" /] among the laws [strongs id="h1881" /] of the Persians [strongs id="h6539" /] and the Medes [strongs id="h4074" /], that it be not altered [strongs id="h5674" tvm="8799" /], That Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /] come [strongs id="h935" tvm="8799" /] no more before [strongs id="h6440" /] king [strongs id="h4428" /] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /]; and let the king [strongs id="h4428" /] give [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8799" /] her royal estate [strongs id="h4438" /] unto another [strongs id="h7468" /] that is better [strongs id="h2896" /] than she.

And when the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] decree [strongs id="h6599" /] which he shall make [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8799" /] shall be published [strongs id="h8085" tvm="8738" /] throughout all his empire [strongs id="h4438" /], (for it is great [strongs id="h7227" /],) all the wives [strongs id="h802" /] shall give [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8799" /] to their husbands [strongs id="h1167" /] honour [strongs id="h3366" /], both to great [strongs id="h1419" /] and small [strongs id="h6996" /].

And the saying [strongs id="h1697" /] pleased [strongs id="h3190" tvm="8799" /] [strongs id="h5869" /] the king [strongs id="h4428" /] and the princes [strongs id="h8269" /]; and the king [strongs id="h4428" /] did [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8799" /] according to the word [strongs id="h1697" /] of Memucan [strongs id="h4462" /]:

For he sent [strongs id="h7971" tvm="8799" /] letters [strongs id="h5612" /] into all the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] provinces [strongs id="h4082" /], into every province [strongs id="h4082" /] according to the writing [strongs id="h3791" /] thereof, and to every people [strongs id="h5971" /] after their language [strongs id="h3956" /], that every man [strongs id="h376" /] should bear rule [strongs id="h8323" tvm="8802" /] in his own house [strongs id="h1004" /], and that [it] should be published [strongs id="h1696" tvm="8764" /] according to the language [strongs id="h3956" /] of every people [strongs id="h5971" /].

After [strongs id="h310" /] these things [strongs id="h1697" /], when the wrath [strongs id="h2534" /] of king [strongs id="h4428" /] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /] was appeased [strongs id="h7918" tvm="8800" /], he remembered [strongs id="h2142" tvm="8804" /] Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /], and what she had done [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8804" /], and what was decreed [strongs id="h1504" tvm="8738" /] against her.

Then said [strongs id="h559" tvm="8799" /] the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] servants [strongs id="h5288" /] that ministered [strongs id="h8334" tvm="8764" /] unto him, Let there be fair [strongs id="h2896" /] [strongs id="h4758" /] young [strongs id="h5291" /] virgins [strongs id="h1330" /] sought [strongs id="h1245" tvm="8762" /] for the king [strongs id="h4428" /]:

And let the king [strongs id="h4428" /] appoint [strongs id="h6485" tvm="8686" /] officers [strongs id="h6496" /] in all the provinces [strongs id="h4082" /] of his kingdom [strongs id="h4438" /], that they may gather together [strongs id="h6908" tvm="8799" /] all the fair [strongs id="h2896" /] [strongs id="h4758" /] young [strongs id="h5291" /] virgins [strongs id="h1330" /] unto Shushan [strongs id="h7800" /] the palace [strongs id="h1002" /], to the house [strongs id="h1004" /] of the women [strongs id="h802" /], unto the custody [strongs id="h3027" /] of Hege [strongs id="h1896" /] the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] chamberlain [strongs id="h5631" /], keeper [strongs id="h8104" tvm="8802" /] of the women [strongs id="h802" /]; and let their things for purification [strongs id="h8562" /] be given [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8800" /] [them]:

And let the maiden [strongs id="h5291" /] which pleaseth [strongs id="h3190" tvm="8799" /] [strongs id="h5869" /] the king [strongs id="h4428" /] be queen [strongs id="h4427" tvm="8799" /] instead of Vashti [strongs id="h2060" /]. And the thing [strongs id="h1697" /] pleased [strongs id="h3190" tvm="8799" /] [strongs id="h5869" /] the king [strongs id="h4428" /]; and he did so [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8799" /].

[Now] in Shushan [strongs id="h7800" /] the palace [strongs id="h1002" /] there was a certain [strongs id="h376" /] Jew [strongs id="h3064" /], whose name [strongs id="h8034" /] [was] Mordecai [strongs id="h4782" /], the son [strongs id="h1121" /] of Jair [strongs id="h2971" /], the son [strongs id="h1121" /] of Shimei [strongs id="h8096" /], the son [strongs id="h1121" /] of Kish [strongs id="h7027" /], a Benjamite [strongs id="h1145" /];

Who had been carried away [strongs id="h1540" tvm="8717" /] from Jerusalem [strongs id="h3389" /] with the captivity [strongs id="h1473" /] which had been carried away [strongs id="h1540" tvm="8717" /] with Jeconiah [strongs id="h3204" /] king [strongs id="h4428" /] of Judah [strongs id="h3063" /], whom Nebuchadnezzar [strongs id="h5019" /] the king [strongs id="h4428" /] of Babylon [strongs id="h894" /] had carried away [strongs id="h1540" tvm="8689" /].

And he brought up [strongs id="h539" tvm="8802" /] Hadassah [strongs id="h1919" /], that [is], Esther [strongs id="h635" /], his uncle’s [strongs id="h1730" /] daughter [strongs id="h1323" /]: for she had neither father [strongs id="h1" /] nor mother [strongs id="h517" /], and the maid [strongs id="h5291" /] [was] fair [strongs id="h3303" /] [strongs id="h8389" /] and beautiful [strongs id="h2896" /] [strongs id="h4758" /]; whom Mordecai [strongs id="h4782" /], when her father [strongs id="h1" /] and mother [strongs id="h517" /] were dead [strongs id="h4194" /], took [strongs id="h3947" tvm="8804" /] for his own daughter [strongs id="h1323" /].

So it came to pass, when the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] commandment [strongs id="h1697" /] and his decree [strongs id="h1881" /] was heard [strongs id="h8085" tvm="8736" /], and when many [strongs id="h7227" /] maidens [strongs id="h5291" /] were gathered together [strongs id="h6908" tvm="8736" /] unto Shushan [strongs id="h7800" /] the palace [strongs id="h1002" /], to the custody [strongs id="h3027" /] of Hegai [strongs id="h1896" /], that Esther [strongs id="h635" /] was brought [strongs id="h3947" tvm="8735" /] also unto the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] house [strongs id="h1004" /], to the custody [strongs id="h3027" /] of Hegai [strongs id="h1896" /], keeper [strongs id="h8104" tvm="8802" /] of the women [strongs id="h802" /].

And the maiden [strongs id="h5291" /] pleased [strongs id="h3190" tvm="8799" /] [strongs id="h5869" /] him, and she obtained [strongs id="h5375" tvm="8799" /] kindness [strongs id="h2617" /] of him [strongs id="h6440" /]; and he speedily [strongs id="h926" tvm="8762" /] gave [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8800" /] her her things for purification [strongs id="h8562" /], with such things as belonged [strongs id="h4490" /] to her, and seven [strongs id="h7651" /] maidens [strongs id="h5291" /], [which were] meet [strongs id="h7200" tvm="8803" /] to be given [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8800" /] her, out of the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] house [strongs id="h1004" /]: and he preferred [strongs id="h8138" tvm="8762" /] her and her maids [strongs id="h5291" /] unto the best [strongs id="h2896" /] [place] of the house [strongs id="h1004" /] of the women [strongs id="h802" /].

Esther [strongs id="h635" /] had not shewed [strongs id="h5046" tvm="8689" /] her people [strongs id="h5971" /] nor her kindred [strongs id="h4138" /]: for Mordecai [strongs id="h4782" /] had charged [strongs id="h6680" tvm="8765" /] her that she should not shew [strongs id="h5046" tvm="8686" /] [it].

And Mordecai [strongs id="h4782" /] walked [strongs id="h1980" tvm="8693" /] every day [strongs id="h3117" /] before [strongs id="h6440" /] the court [strongs id="h2691" /] of the women’s [strongs id="h802" /] house [strongs id="h1004" /], to know [strongs id="h3045" tvm="8800" /] how Esther [strongs id="h635" /] did [strongs id="h7965" /], and what should become [strongs id="h6213" tvm="8735" /] of her.

Now when every maid’s [strongs id="h5291" /] turn [strongs id="h8447" /] was come [strongs id="h5060" tvm="8687" /] to go in [strongs id="h935" tvm="8800" /] to king [strongs id="h4428" /] Ahasuerus [strongs id="h325" /], after [strongs id="h7093" /] that she had been twelve [strongs id="h8147" /] [strongs id="h6240" /] months [strongs id="h2320" /], according to the manner [strongs id="h1881" /] of the women [strongs id="h802" /], (for so were the days [strongs id="h3117" /] of their purifications [strongs id="h4795" /] accomplished [strongs id="h4390" tvm="8799" /], [to wit], six [strongs id="h8337" /] months [strongs id="h2320" /] with oil [strongs id="h8081" /] of myrrh [strongs id="h4753" /], and six [strongs id="h8337" /] months [strongs id="h2320" /] with sweet odours [strongs id="h1314" /], and with [other] things for the purifying [strongs id="h8562" /] of the women [strongs id="h802" /];)

Then thus came [strongs id="h935" tvm="8802" /] [every] maiden [strongs id="h5291" /] unto the king [strongs id="h4428" /]; whatsoever she desired [strongs id="h559" tvm="8799" /] was given [strongs id="h5414" tvm="8735" /] her to go [strongs id="h935" tvm="8800" /] with her out of the house [strongs id="h1004" /] of the women [strongs id="h802" /] unto the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] house [strongs id="h1004" /].

In the evening [strongs id="h6153" /] she went [strongs id="h935" tvm="8802" /], and on the morrow [strongs id="h1242" /] she returned [strongs id="h7725" tvm="8802" /] into the second [strongs id="h8145" /] house [strongs id="h1004" /] of the women [strongs id="h802" /], to the custody [strongs id="h3027" /] of Shaashgaz [strongs id="h8190" /], the king’s [strongs id="h4428" /] chamberlain [strongs id="h5631" /], which kept [strongs id="h8104" tvm="8802" /] the concubines [strongs id="h6370" /]: she came in [strongs id="h935" tvm="8799" /] unto the king [strongs id="h4428" /] no more, except the king [strongs id="h4428" /] delighted [strongs id="h2654" tvm="8804" /] in her, and that she were called [strongs id="h7121" tvm="8738" /] by name [strongs id="h8034" /].
